## üí¨ Click and Select

üì∏ Opens the quick capture bar. Select the option of capture. In this case the second button.

‚úèÔ∏è Select a specific part of your screen by clicking right and using the pencil.

üñåÔ∏è After outlining the section, you can turn it into a Dot to start a thread and share it with others. This makes it easy to mark specific areas on the page and communicate clearly.

‚å®Ô∏è You can also use ALT + A for a quicker way to do it.

<div class="relative box-content w-full max-h-[80vh] aspect-[1.90476] py-10">
  <iframe
    src="https://app.supademo.com/embed/cmj92rg930bznf6zpg6f71s5w?embed_v=2&utm_source=embed"
    loading="lazy"
    title="Sign In to DOT"
    allow="clipboard-write"
    frameborder="0"
    webkitallowfullscreen="true"
    mozallowfullscreen="true"
    allowfullscreen
    class="absolute top-0 left-0 w-full h-full"
  ></iframe>
</div>


### üí° Tips

* Pressing ALT + A to open the capture tool instantly and start outlining without interrupting your workflow.

* Right-click and draw a shape (circle, square, or free-form) around the area you want to point out.

* Outline only the section you want your team to notice to keep your Dot clear and effective.
